messages.title: A CHANGE FOR THE BETTER
messages.content: Robert Jenrick, Newcastle's prospective MP on facing the future together.

messages.title: Health Update
messages.content: Regular meetings with local doctors and campaigning students at Keele.

messages.title: I'll be a strong, independent voice for Newcastle!
I'll quadruple the number of surgeries
messages.content: Weekly advice surgeries for constituents. Online advice via me and my team. Home visits for the less able in the town. A full-time office in the town centre.

messages.title: I'll keep you better informed
messages.content: Quarterly updates in my 'Newcastle News'. Regular public questionnaires. Public monthly accounts on my website. Publish my expenses on my website.

messages.title: I'll cost you less
messages.content: Make minimal expense claims. Employ talented local people, recruited openly and fairly (and no relatives).

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Regular meetings with local doctors and campaigning students at Keele.
Plans to support new jobs and businesses.
Committed to tackling the rising cost of living and unfair expense claims.

issues.economy: In 2010, I want to help build on what we can now see is a rapidly recovering economy after a difficult decade.
issues.education: Frustration in getting a good education was why I studied Law at Cambridge.
issues.environment: I believe in working hard to protect our environment.
issues.health: Regular meetings with local doctors and campaigning students at Keele.

leaflet.personalStatement: If elected, I'll work my socks off for the entire area as a capable, determined and independent-minded and stand up for Newcastle in Westminster.

politicalExperience.role: Solicitor and has worked in different areas of industry and commerce
politicalExperience.achievements: Experience in investment banking, law, and business makes him knowledgeable about the economy and experienced in governance.

images.caption: Robert Jenrick having a discussion at a local meeting.

Robert Jenrick participating in an event or speech.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Despite tuition and youth crime doubling, the Labour government has failed to tackle these issues in the last 13 years.
